translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The third section

analyzed: na ivasaññā nāsañña āyatana kathā  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: The discussion of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception
“In the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is not to be said that perception exists.
“Yes.

original: Asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: a sañña bhavaḥ a sañña gati a sañña sattā vāsaḥ a sañña sa sāraḥ a sañña yoni a saññatta bhāva paṭilābhaḥ uti
translated: “Is there a state of non-perception, a destination of non-perception, a realm of non-perception, a rebirth in a realm of non-perception, a state of non-perception to be felt?

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the ear faculty … in the nose faculty … in the tongue faculty … in the body faculty … in the mind faculty?” …

original: Nanu saññābhavo saññāgati saññāsattāvāso saññāsaṁsāro saññāyoni saññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: nanu saññā bhavaḥ saññā gati saññā sattā vāso saññā sasāro saññā yoni saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Then is there a state of perception, a destination of perception, a realm of perception, a rebirth in a realm of perception, a state of perception to be felt?

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci saññābhavo saññāgati …pe…🔽saññattabhāvapaṭilābho, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci saññā bhavo saññā gati pe  saññatta bhāva paṭilābhaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.

analyzed: nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba  saññā atthi iti  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: “Then it is not to be said that in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is not to be said that perception exists.
“In the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is not to be said that perception exists.
“Yes.
“Is there a state of one perception, a destination of one perception, a realm of one perception, a rebirth in a realm of one perception, a state of one perception to be felt?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu catur vokāra bhavaḥ pe
translated: “Is it not that the fourfold becoming is a destiny …?” …🔽“Are not the four kinds of generation the four kinds of generation?” …
“Then is there a state of four perceptions, a destination of four perceptions, a realm of four perceptions, a rebirth in a realm of four perceptions, a state of four perceptions to be felt?
“Yes.🔽“Then it is not to be said that in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is not to be said that perception exists.
“Is the fourfold becoming, the five kinds of destinations, the seven stations of consciousness, and the three good courses of kamma a kind of perception?

original: attabhāvapaṭilābho, no ca vata re vattabbe—
translated: Or is it not so that it is not to be said that it is a kind of perception?

analyzed: nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba  saññā atthi iti
translated: “Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception?🔽Or is it not so that it is not to be said that it is a kind of perception?🔽“Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the case of the non-percipient beings?
Or is it not so that it is not to be said that it is a kind of perception?

original: “saññā atthi”, so ca asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: saññā atthi so ca a sañña bhavaḥ a sañña gati a sañña sattā vāsaḥ a sañña sa sāraḥ a saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti  āmantā  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: “Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the case of the non-percipient beings, and is that non-percipient becoming, that non-percipient destination, that non-percipient realm of beings, that non-percipient generation, that non-percipient destiny, that non-percipient kind of rebirth, that non-percipient becoming, that non-percipient station of consciousness, that non-percipient support of consciousness, that non-percipient origination of consciousness?

original: “saññā atthi”, so ca asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Asaññasattesu na vattabbaṁ—🔽“saññā atthi”, so ca ekavokārabhavo gati …pe…
analyzed: saññā atthi so ca a sañña bhavaḥ a sañña gati a sañña sattā vāsaḥ a sañña sa sāraḥ a saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  asaññasattesu na vattabba  saññā atthi so ca ekavokāra bhavaḥ gati pe
translated: “Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the case of the non-percipient beings, and is that non-percipient becoming, that non-percipient destination, that non-percipient realm of beings, that non-percipient generation, that non-percipient destiny, that non-percipient kind of rebirth, that non-percipient becoming, that non-percipient station of consciousness, that non-percipient support of consciousness, that non-percipient origination of consciousness?

analyzed: atta bhāva paṭilābho ti  āmantā  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: “Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the case of the non-percipient beings, and is that singlefold becoming, that singlefold destination, that singlefold realm of beings, that singlefold generation, that singlefold destiny, that singlefold kind of rebirth, that singlefold becoming, that singlefold station of consciousness, that singlefold support of consciousness, that singlefold origination of consciousness?

original: “saññā atthi”, so ca ekavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: saññā atthi so ca ekavokāra bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is it not to be said that it is a kind of perception in the case of the non-percipient beings, and is that singlefold becoming, that singlefold destination, that singlefold realm of beings, that singlefold generation, that singlefold destiny,

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: “That is not so,” he said.

analyzed: saññā atthi so ca saññā bhavaḥ saññā gati pe

a perception that is a mode of being?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: saññā atthi so ca saññā bhavaḥ saññā gati pe
translated: “In the case of the non-percipient beings, it is not to be said that perception exists, and that perception is a perception that is a mode of appearance, a perception that is a mode of pervasion, …

analyzed: saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba
translated: a perception that is a mode of being?”🔽“That is not so,” he said.

analyzed: saññā atthi so ca catuvokāra bhavaḥ gati pe

a mode of being?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: saññā atthi so ca catuvokāra bhavaḥ gati pe
translated: “In the case of the non-percipient beings, it is not to be said that perception exists, and that perception is a mode of appearance, a mode of pervasion, …
a mode of being?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nevasaññānāsaññāyatane na vattabba

“In the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, is it to be said that perception exists?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu na ivasaññā nāsañña āyatanam catu vokāra bhavaḥ ti

original: Hañci nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ catuvokārabhavo, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci na ivasaññānāsaññāyatanam catu vokāra bhavaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Then it is not correct to say that in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, perception exists, and that perception is a mode of being.”
“The base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is not to be described as …
“It shouldn’t be said that there is perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.”

analyzed: neva saññā anāsañña āyatanam catu vokāra bhavaḥ neva saññā anāsañña āyatane na vattabba
translated: The dimension of neither perception nor non-perception is a four-constituent existence. It shouldn’t be said that there is perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

“Yes.”

original: “saññā atthī”ti vā “natthī”ti vāti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Adukkhamasukhā vedanāti katvā adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya na vattabbaṁ—

translated: “As regards the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that perception exists there or that perception does not exist there.🔽“As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that feeling exists there or that feeling does not exist there.

analyzed: vedanā ati vai a vedanā ati vā ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that neither-perception-nor-non-perception exists there or that neither-perception-nor-non-perception does not exist there.

analyzed: nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kathā niṭṭhitā  tatiyaḥ vaggo  tassa uddāna
translated: “As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that neither-perception-nor-non-perception is finite or that neither-perception-nor-non-perception is infinite.🔽“As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that it is possible to describe it with the words ‘It is’ or that it is impossible to describe it with the words ‘It is.’

original: Balaṁ sādhāraṇaṁ ariyaṁ,🔽sarāgaṁ cittaṁ vimuccati;🔽Vimuttaṁ vimuccamānaṁ,
analyzed: balam sādhāraṇam  sa rāgam cittam vimuccati  vimuttam vimuccamāna
translated: “As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that it is possible to describe it with the words ‘It is not’ or that it is impossible to describe it with the words ‘It is not.’

analyzed: atthi cittam vimuccamāna  aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa  diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam
translated: “As regards neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it should not be said that it is possible to describe it with the words ‘It is’ and ‘It is not’ or that it is impossible to describe it with the words ‘It is’ and ‘It is not.’

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa  natthi pañca indriyāni cakkhu
